title: IELTS Reading Practice
short_description: AI-generated 40-question reading test focusing on comprehension, skimming, scanning, and logical deduction.
description:
### IELTS Reading Simulation (AI-Powered)

**Engine:** Gemini-3-Pro | **Format:** Academic/General Training Hybrid

This exam is dynamically generated to mimic the complexity of the official IELTS Reading section. It tests your ability to process information quickly and accurately.

**Key Skills Evaluated:**
*   **Skimming & Scanning:** Locating specific facts within dense text.
*   **Logical Argument:** Identifying the writer's views and claims (True/False/Not Given).
*   **Comprehension:** Matching headings and completing summaries.

> *Designed to improve time management and accuracy under pressure.*

title: IELTS Grammar Practice
short_description: Comprehensive grammar drill targeting sentence structures, tenses, and punctuation required for Band 7+ scores.
description:
### Advanced Grammar Proficiency

**Target:** Band 7.0 - 9.0

While IELTS does not have a standalone grammar section, grammatical range and accuracy are crucial for the Writing and Speaking modules. This AI-generated set isolates specific grammatical pitfalls.

**Focus Areas:**
- **Complex Sentences:** Subordinate clauses and relative pronouns.
- **Tense Consistency:** Perfect, continuous, and future forms.
- **Structural Accuracy:** Subject-verb agreement, articles, and prepositions.
- **Error Identification:** Spotting common mistakes in academic writing.

title: IELTS Vocabulary Practice
short_description: Intensive vocabulary test covering academic synonyms, collocations, and idiomatic language to boost Lexical Resource.
description:
### Lexical Resource Builder

**Objective:** Enhance Vocabulary Range

A robust vocabulary is the backbone of a high IELTS score. This exam focuses on synonyms, antonyms, and contextual usage to help you avoid repetition in Writing and Speaking.

**Topic Coverage:**
*   **Academic Vocabulary:** Formal words used in higher education contexts.
*   **Collocations:** Words that naturally go together (e.g., 'heavy rain' vs 'strong rain').
*   **Idiomatic Language:** Common English idioms and phrasal verbs.
*   **Paraphrasing:** The ability to express the same idea using different words.

title: IELTS Listening Practice
short_description: Simulated listening test with 4 sections covering social conversations, monologues, and academic discussions.
description:
### IELTS Listening Simulation

**Format:** 4 Sections | 40 Questions

This AI-generated practice test simulates the progression of difficulty found in the actual listening exam, moving from everyday social contexts to complex academic discourse.

**Section Breakdown:**
1.  **Social Conversation:** A dialogue between two speakers in a daily context.
2.  **Social Monologue:** A speech about local facilities or everyday arrangements.
3.  **Academic Discussion:** A conversation between up to four people in an educational setting.
4.  **Academic Monologue:** A lecture on a university-level subject.

title: BACE: Biotechnology Skills (Practical)
short_description: 60-question practical section focusing on aseptic techniques, micropipetting, and solution preparation.
description:
### Badge: Biotechnology Skills

**Type:** Practical | **Weight:** 23% of Exam

This module tests the foundational hands-on skills required in a laboratory setting. Questions often involve procedural ordering and image analysis.

**Key Topics:**
*   **Aseptic Technique:** Sterility maintenance and contamination avoidance.
*   **Micropipetting:** Correct usage of micro/macro pipettes.
*   **Solution Prep:** pH adjustments, buffers, and serial dilutions.
*   **Cell Culture:** Streaking plates and maintaining cell lines.

> *Recommended Resource: Bio-Rad Lab Skills Course*

title: BACE: Technical Skills & Applications
short_description: 50-question knowledge section covering PCR, Electrophoresis, Immunoassays, and Chromatography.
description:
### Badge: Technical Skills & Applications

**Type:** Knowledge | **Weight:** 19% of Exam

Focuses on the theoretical understanding of common molecular biology assays and the ability to select the correct assay for a given scenario.

**Key Topics:**
*   **PCR:** qPCR vs. Conventional methods.
*   **Electrophoresis:** Agarose gel and PAGE.
*   **Immunoassays:** ELISA workflows.
*   **Recombinant DNA:** Cloning vectors and transformation.
*   **Analytical Methods:** Spectroscopy and Chromatography.

title: BACE: Applied Mathematics
short_description: 30-question calculation section on dilutions, molarity, unit conversions, and standard curves.
description:
### Badge: Applied Mathematics

**Type:** Practical | **Weight:** 11.5% of Exam

Tests the ability to perform essential laboratory calculations and interpret graphical data. Requires numeric entry and graph analysis.

**Formulas & Concepts:**
*   **Dilutions:** $C_1V_1 = C_2V_2$ calculations.
*   **Solutions:** Molarity (M) and Percent solutions (w/v, v/v).
*   **Data Handling:** Significant figures and Scientific Notation.
*   **Conversions:** $\mu L \leftrightarrow mL$ and other metric conversions.
*   **Analysis:** Standard curve interpretation from linear plots.

title: BACE: Safety & Workplace Culture
short_description: 30-question section on PPE, MSDS/SDS reading, biohazard disposal, and emergency response.
description:
### Badge: Safety & Workplace Culture

**Type:** Knowledge | **Weight:** 11.5% of Exam

Ensures candidates understand the regulatory and safety frameworks necessary to work safely in a biolab environment.

**Key Topics:**
*   **PPE:** Hierarchy of controls and selection.
*   **Documentation:** Reading Safety Data Sheets (SDS).
*   **Waste Management:** Chemical vs. Biohazard disposal.
*   **Emergency:** Spill containment and Fire safety.
*   **Standards:** OSHA regulations and BSL Levels.

title: BACE: Biochemistry & Molecular Biology
short_description: 30-question theory section on the Central Dogma, protein folding, enzyme kinetics, and DNA replication.
description:
### Badge: Biochemistry & Molecular Biology

**Type:** Knowledge | **Weight:** 10% of Exam

Tests conceptual understanding of biological processes at the molecular level.

**Key Topics:**
*   **Central Dogma:** DNA $\rightarrow$ RNA $\rightarrow$ Protein flow.
*   **Proteins:** Structure (primary to quaternary) and folding.
*   **Kinetics:** Enzyme activity ($K_m$, $V_{max}$).
*   **Therapeutics:** Monoclonal antibodies (mAb).
*   **Genetics:** DNA replication mechanisms.

title: BACE: Regulation & Quality Control
short_description: 20-question section covering cGMP, GLP, QA/QC roles, ALCOA principles, and documentation.
description:
### Badge: Regulation & Quality

**Type:** Knowledge | **Weight:** 9% of Exam

Focuses on the strict quality standards required in biomanufacturing and research industries.

**Key Topics:**
*   **Guidelines:** cGMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) & GLP.
*   **Roles:** Quality Assurance (QA) vs. Quality Control (QC).
*   **Documentation:** SOPs, Batch Records, and GDP.
*   **Data Integrity:** ALCOA principles.
*   **Agencies:** FDA and ISO 9001 standards.

title: BACE: Equipment & Experimental Design
short_description: Combined practice for equipment troubleshooting (Centrifuge, Autoclave) and experimental error analysis.
description:
### Badge: Standard Equipment & Experimental Design

**Type:** Practical | **Weight:** 15% of Exam

Combines equipment operational knowledge with the logic required to design valid experiments.

**Equipment Topics:**
*   Centrifuge balancing and Rotor types.
*   Spectrophotometer operation.
*   Autoclave cycles and Microscope care.

**Design Topics:**
*   Experimental controls (+/-) and Replicates.
*   Lab Notebook legal standards.
*   Error Analysis & PCA (Principal Component Analysis).
